intro: Penstemon procerus f. geniculatus, commonly known as the slender beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically blooms in late summer, producing vivid pink to purple flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are linear and often hairy, adapted to thrive in dry, rocky environments. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance in native plant gardens.
